methods.name: isCollateralWithdrawn
methods.description:
Returns true if the collateral associated with the given agreement ID
has already been seized.

methods.name: returnCollateralAsync
methods.description:
Returns collateral to the debt agreement's original collateralizer
if and only if the debt agreement's term has lapsed and
the total expected repayment value has been repaid.

methods.name: seizeCollateralAsync
methods.description:
Seizes the collateral from the given debt agreement and
transfers it to the debt agreement's beneficiary.

methods.name: validateAsync
methods.description:
Validates that the basic invariants have been met for a given
CollateralizedSimpleInterestLoanOrder.

methods.name: fromDebtOrder
methods.description:
Asynchronously generates a simple interest loan order given a Dharma
debt order instance.

methods.name: fromDebtRegistryEntry
methods.description:
Asynchronously translates a Dharma debt registry entry into a
simple interest loan order.

methods.name: toDebtOrder
methods.description:
Asynchronously generates a Dharma debt order given an instance of a
simple interest loan order.

methods.name: validateAsync
methods.description: Validates that the basic invariants have been met for a given SimpleInterestLoanOrder.

methods.name: awaitTransactionMinedAsync
methods.description:
Asynchronously polls the Ethereum blockchain until the specified
transaction has been mined or the timeout limit is reached, whichever
occurs first.

methods.name: getErrorLogs
methods.description:
Asynchronously retrieve any error logs that might have occurred during a
given transaction. These errors are returned as human-readable strings.

methods.name: getTermsContractType
methods.description: Given a terms contract address, returns the name of that contract.

methods.name: getTokenAddressByIndexAsync
methods.description:
Given the index of a token in the Token Registry, returns the address of that
token's contract.

methods.name: loadTokenByIndexAsync
methods.description:
Given the index of a token in the token registry, loads an instance of that
token and returns it.

methods.name: approveAsync
setApprovalForAllAsync
transferAsync
transferFromAsync
methods.params:
from: string,
to: string,
tokenID: BigNumber,
data: string,
options: TxData

methods.name: assertFillableAsync
methods.description: Throws with error message if a given order is not able to be filled.

methods.name: cancelOrderAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously cancel a debt order if it has yet to be fulfilled.

methods.name: checkOrderFilledAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously checks whether the order is filled.

methods.name: fillAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously fills a signed debt order.

methods.name: generate
methods.description:
Generate a Dharma debt order, given the specified adapter and its associated
parameters object.

methods.name: getDebtOrder
methods.description: Given an issuanceHash, returns a DebtOrder instance.

methods.name: getIssuanceHash
methods.description:
Given a complete debt order, asynchronously computes the issuanceHash
(alias of debtAgreementId) of the debt order.

methods.name: unpackTerms
methods.description:
Decode tightly-packed representation of debt agreement's terms in a
given debt order into an object with human-interpretable keys and values.

methods.name: getDebtRegistryEntry
methods.description:
Asynchronously retrieve the `DebtRegistryEntry` instance mapped to the
issuance hash specified.

methods.name: getDebtsAsync
methods.description:
Given a debtor's account, returns a list of issuance hashes
corresponding to debts which the debtor has issued in the past.

methods.name: getExpectedValueRepaid
methods.description:
Asynchronously determine the expected value of repayments at a given
point in time for a given debt agreement.

methods.name: getInvestmentsAsync
methods.description:
Given a creditor's account, returns a list of issuance hashes
corresponding to debts which the creditor has invested in.

methods.name: getTotalExpectedRepayment
methods.description:
Given an issuanceHash, returns the total amount that the borrower is expected to
pay by the end of the associated terms agreement.

methods.name: getValueRepaid
methods.description:
Asynchronously retrieve the amount that has been repaid to date towards a
debt agreement.

methods.name: makeRepayment
methods.description: Asynchronously issue a repayment towards a debt agreement.

methods.name: asCreditor
methods.description:
Given a debt order, produce ECDSA signature of the creditor commitment hash using the creditor's
private key.  If current web3 provider is unable to produce a cryptographic signature using
the creditor's private key (for instance, if the account is not unlocked in Geth / Parity), it
throws.

methods.name: asDebtor
methods.description:
Given a debt order, produce ECDSA signature of the debtor commitment hash using the debtor's
private key.  If current web3 provider is unable to produce a cryptographic signature using
the debtor's private key (for instance, if the account is not unlocked in Geth / Parity), it
throws.

methods.name: asUnderwriter
methods.description:
Given a debt order, produce ECDSA signature of the underwriter commitment hash using the underwriter's
private key.  If current web3 provider is unable to produce a cryptographic signature using
the underwriter's private key (for instance, if the account is not unlocked in Geth / Parity), it
throws.

methods.name: getBalanceAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously retrieve the balance of tokens for the owner specified.

methods.name: getNumDecimals
methods.description: Asynchronously retrieve the number of decimal points used by the given token.

methods.name: getProxyAllowanceAsync
methods.description:
Asynchronously determine the allowance afforded to the
`tokenTransferProxy` allotted by the specified owner.

methods.name: getSupportedTokens
methods.description:
Returns an array of token attributes, including symbol and name, for tokens that are
listed in Dharma's token registry.

methods.name: getTokenSymbolList
methods.description: Asynchronously retrieve the list of symbols of the tokens in the TokenRegistry.

methods.name: setProxyAllowanceAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously set an allowance to the `tokenTransferProxy`.

methods.name: setUnlimitedProxyAllowanceAsync
methods.description: Asynchronously set an unlimited proxy allowance to the `tokenTransferProxy`.

methods.name: transferAsync
methods.description:
Asynchronously transfer value denominated in the specified ERC20 token to
the address specified.

methods.name: transferFromAsync
methods.description:
Asynchronously transfer the value amount in the token specified so long
as the sender of the message has received sufficient allowance on behalf
of `from` to do so.
methods.params:
tokenAddress: string,
from: string,
to: string,
value: BigNumber,
options: TxData

getCreditorCommitmentHash
methods.description:
Returns the payload that a creditor must sign in order to
indicate her consent to the parameters of the debt order --
which is, currently, the debt order's hash.

methods.name: getDebtAgreementId
methods.description:
Returns the debt agreement's unique identifier --
an alias for the issuance commitment hash cast to a BigNumber

methods.name: getDebtorCommitmentHash
methods.description:
Returns the payload that a debtor must sign in order to
indicate her consent to the parameters of the debt order --
which is, currently, the debt order's hash.

methods.name: getHash
methods.description:
Returns the hash of the debt order in its entirety, in the order defined
in the Dharma whitepaper.
See https://whitepaper.dharma.io/#debtorcreditor-commitment-hash

methods.name: getIssuanceCommitment
methods.description:
Returns the subset of the debt order we refer to as the "Issuance Commitment".
See https://whitepaper.dharma.io/#debt-issuance-commitments

methods.name: getIssuanceCommitmentHash
methods.description:
Returns the hash of this debt order's "Issuance Commitment".
See https://whitepaper.dharma.io/#debt-issuance-commitments

methods.name: getUnderwriterCommitmentHash
methods.description:
Returns the payload that an underwriter must sign in order to
indicate her consent to the parameters of the debt order, as
defined in the Dharma whitepaper.
